alert.note: Alert for Chaffee (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 12:35PM MDT until August 05 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Chaffee County in central Colorado... * Until 345 PM MDT. * At 1235 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near the Chalk Cliffs in the Chalk Creek drainage. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, highways, roads and underpasses. Mud flows will be possible if the heavier rain impacts the Chalk Cliffs area. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Alpine. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
